text: Pours dark amber from the bottle and leaves a thin, creamy head that lingers. Aroma is strongly of caramel, with hints of turpentine. Taste is sweet with strong notes of butterscotch in the finish. Thick, sticky, very warming, but the ABV remains largely hidden. Overall, not bad. Would have no doubt been more agreeable on a cooler day.

33 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden amber. Huge tan head. Aroma is toasted malty and slight caramelish. Sweet. Caramelish and breadish. Mild mazripan note. Toasted and breadish into a malty finish. Slight dry and bitter.

Aroma: malty, herbs, peach.
Appearance: golden color and creamy head.
Taste: low herbal bitterness, esters, peachy, malty, sticky, semi-sweet.
Palate: full body and medium carbonation.
Overall: interesting doppelmaibock, nice malty backbone.
The beer has got a hazy orange-brown colour with a small ehad and smooth body. Aroma of sweet bread, sugar and caramel. Taste of malt, vanilla, oak, caramel and biscuits. Intense sweet finish.

Die Idee mag zwar hervorragend sein, aber die Umsetzung erinnert mich stark an ein billiges polnisches Imperial Pils. Ordentlich Sirup mit einer gewissen Portion an Lakritze und derber Süße gemeinsam mit einem erstaunlich bitteren Abgang stellen hier nicht wirklich ein rundes Bild dar. Zu unausgewogen.

0.33 cl bottle. Pours a dark hazy amber with a lot of tan foam. Aroma of yeast with grassy tones mixed in. The taste is malty with toffee and hints of peach but only a subtle amount of alcohol that really comes through. Decently tart in the finish.

L:
-pours a hazy amber colour with a small to medium,creamy,offwhite head
-medium carbonation visible
S:
-leather,caramel,grainy,earthy,toaste malts
T:
-caramel,honey,oranges,bready,red apple
-low bitterniss
F:
-medium carbonation
-medium to full body
-alcohol very noticeable
O:
Too sweet and too alcoholic for me.
Not particularly complex either.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2017 Bottle. Orange-copper colored with a small creamy head. Fruity notes of plum, grapes, peach and a sherry/brandy note, with spices and vanilla. Malty notes as well, biscuits and caramel. Medium sweet taste with a light balancing bitter finish. Quite pleasent. Full thick body, low carbonation and a creamy mouthfeel. Complex flavor with a wide array of distinctive fruity and malty notes, plum, grapes, peach, sherry, biscuits, caramel and yeast. Nevertheless very harmonic. Warm, alcoholic finish without strong spicy/peppery notes. Very good.
Aus der Flasche getrunken (Direktlieferung aus der Manufaktur). Leicht trübes Kupfer mit stabiler Schaumkrone. Schöner leichter Malzkörper.

33cl bb11/2018, Maruhn. - Makes easy sipping from a heavyset style without any real surplus to make a case for it: Calypso adds some peach/mirabelle and candied lemon jam to the honey biscuit compote, but buries it malt-deep. Less alcoholic, syrupy and maltstarchy "mastig" than many a 7%ish Bock.
Pours a deep amber color. Sweet, roasted aroma with sugar, caramel, and booze tones. Flavor is sweet and boozey with some earthy malt notes.
Samtiger Kräuterbursche mit nettem Whiskeyflashbacks...Good Stuff :).. 0,1 vom Fass in der ELBPHILHARMONIE HH.
Trocken hefiger Beginn mit leichten Fruchtnoten. Spritzig, später etwas süßer, das Ganze bleibt aber zurückhaltend. Rund, gut. 10/11/12/11//11
Sampled @ BKL 2017. Sehr trübes orange goldenes Bier mit einer mittelgroßen beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch nach reifen Früchten, Obst. Geschmack süß malzig, karamellig, reife Früchte, okay.
Bottle. Hazy orange color with white head. Aroma is spicy, grainy. Taste is sweetish, peach, sirupy. Oily mouthfeel. Okay.

0.33 l bottle from the brewerys web shop, best before January 2019. Clear, reddish amber with a medium large, frothy, almost stable, off-white head. Faint, sweetish-malty and a bit fruity aroma of caramel, honey, orange jam and hints of pine. Rather sweet, malty, slightly fruity and a little resiny taste of caramel, honey, straw, dried apricots, orange jam and hints of pine, followed by a medium long, moderately bitter, slightly resiny and a bit warming-alcoholic finish. Medium to full body, slightly oily and quite effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Quite tasty, a bit too much carbonation maybe, but the result could likely have been achieved with less alcohol I guess.
330ml Flasche. Braun mit Trübung und kleiner Schaumkrone. Malzig und kräftig im Antrunk. Karamellnoten. Voller Körper. Milder Abgang.

Nice small bottle with a lot of information but not the drinktemperature. But this is not important here.
Clear amber beer with cream-colored head, smell is alcoholic, taste is sweet and malty but not too much, caramel, full body, sticky, 
(I have 0.33l bottle with batch L3342159 and best-before 29.11.2018)
